dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class SWTColumnDescription

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTColumnDescription
Direct Known Subclasses:
SWTTreeColumnDescription
public class SWTColumnDescription
extends java.lang.Object

A Table Column Description defines the type, width, name, mementoId, tooltip and defaultvalue of a table column. Example: 

 SWTColumnDescription[] descs = new SWTColumnDescription[5];
 descs[0] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Float", "MEMENTO1", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.FLOAT, 100, "1.1" );
 descs[1] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Integer", "MEMENTO2", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.INTEGER, 100, "2" );
 descs[2] = new SWTColumnDescription( "String", "MEMENTO3", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.TEXT, 100, "abc" );
 descs[3] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Boolean", "MEMENTO4", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.BOOLEAN, 100, "false" );
 descs[4] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Combo", "MEMENTO5", 100, new String[]{"ONE", "TWO", "THREE"}, "ONE" );
 
 factory.createTable( parentComposite,
                      IConstants.WIDGET_ID_TABLE,
                      IConstants.MEMENTO_KEY_TABLE,
                      "My Table",
                      10,
                      descs,
                      WidgetFactory.TABLE_ACTION_ALL );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

public SWTColumnDescription(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String mementoId,
                            WidgetFactory.TextFormat format,
                            java.lang.String defaultValue)
Describes a SWTTable column An index column is automatically inserted into the table.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column
mementoId - the mementoId
format - the format of the column see WidgetFactory.TextFormat
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
Since:
2008.b

getCellEditorFactory

Returns:

Since:
2009.a

setCellEditorFactory

public void setCellEditorFactory(CellEditorFactory cellEditorFactory)
Set the CellEditorFactory via which the cell editors for this column are instantiated.

The CellEditorFactory can be set after the table is created (except for WidgetFactory.TextFormat.BOOLEAN columns).

Mind that the support for custom cell editors for WidgetFactory.TextFormat.BOOLEAN columns is currently limited in some ways:

  • the custom cell editor factory must be set before the table is created, effectively making it impossible to be used together with pages defined by the XForms API
  • there is currently no way to dynamically switch to the default cell editor in tables
  • the column is still rendered with some check box icon in tree tables

Parameters:
cellEditorFactory - the cellEditorFactory to set. For row aware factories, subclass one of AbstractTableRowCellEditorFactory or AbstractTreeTableRowCellEditorFactory respectively.
Since:
2009.a
